text: In a agile platform rollout in fintech where a new analyst is struggling with stakeholder prep and deadlines are tight, what should the project manager do to recognize and act on mentoring opportunities?

options.label: offer coaching immediately after observing a skill gap in a meeting
fix the work yourself to save time
wait for performance reviews to give guidance
reserve mentoring only for high performers

explanation: Option a is correct because timely coaching turns observation into growth. Option b is incorrect because doing it alone removes the learning opportunity. Option c is incorrect because delayed feedback wastes immediate teaching moments. Option d is incorrect because limiting mentoring overlooks others who need growth.

text: Given a cross-functional platform rollout in healthcare where a junior PM is new to the company and several interns started recently, which action best helps recognize and act on mentoring opportunities?

options.label: criticize errors publicly without coaching
pair a junior member with an expert for a challenging task
dismiss small mistakes as unimportant
fix the work yourself to save time

explanation: Option b is correct because pairing creates a structured mentoring moment. Option a is incorrect because public criticism harms morale and teaches little. Option c is incorrect because ignoring signals misses chances to build capability. Option d is incorrect because doing it alone removes the learning opportunity.
